children.name: to control the speed temperature or amount of sth
control b1
children.definition: control/kənˈtrəʊl/  to make the temperature, speed, or amount of something stay at the level you want: điều khiển, kiểm soát
examples: ▪ a valve controls the flow of water into the main tank.
▪ the finance committee controls the club’s budget.

children.name: keep under control b2
children.definition: keep something under control/ˌkiːp something ʌndəʳ kənˈtrəʊl/  to prevent an amount of something from becoming too large:
examples: ▪ he’s been trying for years to keep hbis drinking under control.
▪ the administration has certainly succeeded in keeping inflation under control.

children.name: regulate c1
children.definition: regulate/ˈregjɑleɪt/  to keep the temperature, speed, or amount of something atexactlytherightlevel:điều chỉnh ( về mức độ ổn định )
examples: ▪ sweating helps regulate body temperature.
▪ a hand-operated switch is used to regulate the gas flow.

children.name: to control people or what happens
control b1
children.definition: control to make things happen or make people behavein the waythat you want, by using yourauthority,skill,moneyetc:kiểm soát
examples: ▪ miss weston is having difficulty controlling the children in that class.
▪ the area is now controlled by rebels.
▪ the head of department controls the budget.
▪ oloco is a huge company, controlling over half the world’s oil trade.

children.name: in control b2
children.definition: be in control to control a situation, organization, country etc - use this especially aboutsbwho got their power by using force or by clever planning, butnot by being elected:nắm quyền kiểm soát
examples: ▪ the president has been arrested, and the rebel forces are now in control.
be in control of
▪ mr howard questioned whether the police were still in control of the situation.

children.name: what sb says, goes x
children.definition: what somebody says, goes/wɒt somebody ˌsez ˈgəʊz/spokenused to say that someone has the power to make all the decisions and tell other people what to do :
examples: toàn quyền thuộc về ai
▪ mrs earnshaw is in charge, and what she says, goes.
bà earnshaw phụ trách, và giờ là toàn quyền của bà ấy

children.name: in the driving seat x
children.definition: be in the driving seatbritish /be in the driver’s seatamerican /biː ɪn ðə ˈdraɪvɪŋ siːt, biː ɪn ðə ˈdraɪvəʳz siːt/ informalto have morepowerthan anyone else in a particular organization or situation, so that you control everything :
examples: là người cầm lái , nắm quyền điều hành, kiểm soát
▪ the conservatives say they are looking forward to the election, and are confident that they will soon be back in the driving seat.
các nhà tư tưởng bảo thủ nói ràng họ đang rất trông chờ vào cuộc bầu cử, và họ rất tự tin rằng họ sẽ sớm nắm được quyền kiểm soát
be firmly in the driving seat.
chắc chắn nắm quyền kiểm soát
▪ this is how the government is now made up, with the socialists firmly in the driving seat.
đây là cách mà chính phủ được hình thành, với những người cộng sản hoàn toàn nắm quyền kiểm soát

children.name: call the tune x
children.definition: call the tune/shots/ˌkɔːl ðə ˈtjuːn, ˈʃɒtsǁ-ˈtuːn, -ˈʃɑːts/ informalto control a situation so that everyone else has to do what you say, agree with you etc:
examples: nắm quyền quản lí, kiểm soát ...
▪ it’s definitely my mother who calls the shots in my family.
mẹ tôi chắc chắn là người nằm toàn quyền quản lí trong gia đình
▪ it’s always been our policy that the customer should call the tune.
chính sách của chúng tôi luôn luôn là khách hàng nắm quyền kiểm soát

children.name: be the boss
children.definition: /biː ðə ˈbɒsǁ-ˈbɔːs/  if you say someone is the boss within a family or group, you mean they have the most power over the other people in it :
examples: là là chủ (người nắm quyền )
▪ you’d better ask mom -- she’s the boss around here.
hỏi mẹ đi - bà ấy là người làm chủ ở quanh đây
show somebody who’s boss : show them that you are in control.:
cho ai biết ai là chủ
▪ he gave the dog a slap round the head, just to show him who was boss.
hắn đánh vào đầu con chó một cái chỉ để cho nó biết rằng ai mới là ông chủ.

children.name: wear the trousers x
children.definition: wear the trousers/ˌweəʳ ðə ˈtraʊzəʳz/  informal to be the person who has most power in a relationship - use this especially to say that the woman in a relationship controls the man : nắm quyền
examples: ▪ i think you should talk to pat - she’s the one who wears the trousers in that household.

children.name: keep in check x
children.definition: keep/hold somebody/something in check/ˌkiːp, ˌhəʊld somebody/something ɪn ˈtʃek/  if you keep people in check, you control their behaviour, especially so that they cannot behave badly; if you keep a situation, especially a bad one, in check, you stop it developing any further:
examples: giữ ( ai / cái gì ) trong tầm kiểm soát
▪ the court heard that the general was unable to keep his troops in check.
▪ the disease is held in check by weekly injections of a power drug.

children.name: to get control of a situation, country, organization etc
take control b2
children.definition: take control /ˌteɪk kənˈtrəʊl/  to get control of a situation, organization, or place:
examples: nắm quyền kiểm soát, điều hành
▪ he’s invested a lot of money in the company since he took control last may.
ông ấy đã đầu tư rất nhiều tiền vào công ty kể từ khi ông ta nắm quyền kiểm soát vào hồi tháng 5 năm ngoái
take control of: nắm quyền kiểm sát, điều hành cái gì
▪ following requests from the police, the army has now taken control of the area.
theo yêu cầu của cảnh sát, quân đội đã nắm được quyền kiểm soát trong khu vực
▪ anne williams will take control of the research division on august 5th.
anne williams sẽ nắm quyền kiểm soát bộ phận nghiên cứu vào ngày 5 tháng 8

children.name: take over x
children.definition: take over /ˌteɪk ˈəʊvəʳ/  to get control of acompanyororganization, or become theleader,presidentetcaftersomeone else:
examples: tiếp quản
▪ people are wondering who’s going to take over when the old dictator dies.
mọi người đang tự hỏi ai sẽ nắm tiếp quản khi ông ta chết
take over something/take something over: tiếp quản cái gì
▪ the company was taken over by sony in 1989.
công ty này được sony mua lại từ năm 1989
take over from:tiếp quản ai
▪ she took over from barton as managing director in 1994.
bà ta đã tiếp vị trí giám đốc quản lí từ barton vào năm 1994

children.name: bring under control b2
children.definition: bring something under control/ˌbrɪŋ something ʌndəʳ kənˈtrəʊl/  to get control of a situation that is out of control:
examples: giành lại quyền kiểm soát /điều hành
▪ the agriculture ministry is struggling to bring the latest outbreak of the disease under control.
bộ nông nghiệp đang phải vật lộn để đưa bệnh dịch vào tầm kiểm soát
▪ rioting broke out again last night, and police and soldiers are still struggling to bring the situation under control.
cuộc nổi loạn bạo lực đã nổ ra vào đem qua và cảnh sát cùng quân đội phải vật lộn để giành lại quyền kiểm soát
.▪ government attempts to bring the drug problem under control have so far failed.
sự cố gắng của chính phủ nhằm đưa vấn đề ma túy vào tầm kiểm soát đã không thành công

children.name: regain control b2
children.definition: regain control/rɪˌgeɪn kənˈtrəʊl/  to get control of a situation again after you hadlostcontrol of it: giành lại quyền kiểm soát /điều hành
examples: ▪ it took several hours for the police to regain control after a demonstration in the city centre turned violent.regain control of.
phải mất mấy giờ để cảnh sát giành lại quyền kiểm soát sau khi một cuộc biểu tình ở trung tâm thành phố trở nên quá bạo lực.
▪ the extremists have managed to regain control of the party.
những người chủ nghĩ cực đoan cuối cùng đã giành lại quyền kiểm soát đảng
▪ at last she seemed to regain control of the situation, and started to speak.
cuối cùng thi cô ấy dường như đã có thể hiểu được tình hình và bắt đầu nói chuyện

children.name: seize c2
children.definition: seize/siːz/  if anarmyorgroupseizes power or an area of land, they get control of it byusingforceto suddenly take political control:
examples: đoạt quyền
▪ the general has been head of state since he seized power in 1982.
thủ tướng đã là người đừng đầu bang đó kể từ khi ông ta nắm quyền năm 1980
▪ rebel soldiers attacked the island, seizing the capital and arresting government officials.
những người nổi dậy đã tấn công hoàn đảo đó và chiếm được thủ đô và bắt giữ quan chức chính phủ

children.name: take u
children.definition: take/teɪk/  to getpoliticalandmilitarycontrol of a country or part of a country, especially during awar:chiếm giữ, nắm quyền kiểm soá
examples: ▪ rebel forces have taken the northern part of the region.
lực lượng khủng bố đã nắm được quyền kiểm soát phía bắc ở vùng này

children.name: channel c2
children.definition: channelverb-ll-orus usually-l-
examples: to direct something into a particular place or situation
_ditches were constructed to channelwateraway from the buildings.
_if she could only channel all thatenergy intosomething useful.
_a lot ofmoneyhas been channelledintoresearch in that particular field.

children.name: make your presence felt c2
children.definition: makeyourpresence felt
examples: to have a strong effect on other people or on a situation
_the new police chief has really made his presence felt.

children.name: to secretly control people or events
manipulate x
children.definition: manipulate to make someone do what you want them to do bycleverlyinfluencing them, especially when they do not realize what you are doing : lôi kéo, vận động, thao túng
examples: ▪ he accused the environmentalists of trying to manipulate public opinion in their favour.
manipulative[adjective] clever at manipulating people
▪ she’s a devious and manipulative young woman.

children.name: have sb in your pocket x
children.definition: have somebody in your pocket/hæv somebody ɪn jɔːʳ ˈpɒktǁ-ˈpɑː-/  to be able to control someone such as a policeman or politician so that they do what you want, for example because you know something bad about them, or you are illegally paying them money or threatening them : dắt mũi ai, khống chế ai
examples: ▪ most drug dealers have a few cops in their pocket.
▪ jackson got these plans approved very easily - it makes you wonder if he had the local council in his pocket.

children.name: be pulling the strings x
children.definition: be pulling the strings/biː ˌpʊlɪŋ ðə ˈstrɪŋz/  tosecretlycontrol an organization, country or situation, by controlling the person or group that isofficiallyin charge of it:
examples: giật dây ( bí mật điều hành người , nhóm, nhà nước đang nắm quyền )
▪ there is little doubt now who is pulling the strings behind this government.
hiện có ít nghi ngờ về việc ai đang giật dây đằng sau chính phủ.

children.name: to be controlled by sb else
under sb’s control b2
children.definition: be under somebody’s control/biː ˌʌndəʳ somebodyˈs kənˈtrəʊl/
examples: ▪ the whole town seems to be under the control of one family.
▪ almost three thousand troops are under captain marsh’s control.
▪ roughly a quarter of the area came under soviet control.

children.name: under sb’s spell x
children.definition: be under somebody’s spell/biː ˌʌndəʳ somebodyˈs ˈspel/  if you are under someone’s spell they have almost complete power over how you feel, the way you behave etc especially because youloveoradmirethem very much:
examples: bị ai bỏ bùa ( vì bạn say mê họ )
▪ harry knew that he was in love with susie, completely under her spell.
harry biết anh đang yêu susie, anh ấy hoàn bị bị cô ấy bỏ bùa mê rồi.
come/fall under somebody’s spellstart to be under someone’s spell:
bị dính bùa mê của ai
▪ she loves the company of showbiz personalities, and many have fallen under her spell.
cô ấy thích mọi người trong công ty showbiz, và nhiều người đã bị dính bùa mê của cô ấy.

children.name: in sb’s power b2
children.definition: be in somebody’s power/biː ɪn somebodyˈs ˈpaʊəʳ/  if you are in someone’s power you have to do whatever they want you to do, especially because they have someemotionalpowerover you - used especially inliterature:
examples: bị ai kiểm soát ( bằng sức mạnh cảm xúc )
▪ he’ll do whatever i tell him to do. he’s completely in my power.
anh ta sẽ làm bất cứ điều gì mà tôi bảo, anh ta đang bị tôi kiểm soát

children.name: at sb’s mercy c2
children.definition: be at somebody’s mercy/biː ət somebodyˈs ˈmɜːʳsi/  if you are at someone’s mercy they have the power to decide whether good or bad things happen to you :
examples: phó mặc cuộc đời cho ai
▪ once in prison, inmates are at the guards’ mercy.
một khi ở tù, các phạm nhân phải dưới quyền quyết định cảu các lính canh
▪ children often find themselves at the mercy of other kids who are older and bigger.
trẻ con thường nghe lời những đứa trẻ khác lớn hơn chúng
to be at the mercy of somebody :phó mặc cuộc đời cho ai
▪ small firms are completely at the mercy of the banks.
các công ty nhỏ lẻ thường dưới quyền quyết định của các ngân hàng

children.name: doormat x
children.definition: doormat/ˈdɔːʳmæt/  informal someone who lets other people treat them badly and who does not complain or try to change their situation : thảm chùi chân
examples: ▪ fiona was determined that she would be nobody’s doormat.
▪ make sure he doesn’t treat you like a doormat

children.name: lose control b2
children.definition: lose control/ˌluːz kənˈtrəʊl/  to no longer be able to control a situation, vehicle, group of people etc: mất kiểm soát
examples: ▪ the car skidded on the ice, and i lost control.
lose control of
▪ she felt as if she was losing control of her children.
▪ o'connor recently lost control of the company he had run for seven years.

children.name: out of control b2
children.definition: out of control/ˌaʊt əv kənˈtrəʊl/  asituationthat is out of control has got much worse and can no longer be controlled:
examples: ( một tình huống ) ngoài tầm kiểm soát
▪ the fire was out of control.
▪ teenage crime was now out of control.
get out of control : trở nên ngoài tầm kiểm soát
▪ it’s easy to let spending on credit cards get out of control.

be beyond sb’s control/biː bɪˌjɒnd somebodyˈs kənˈtrəʊlǁ -ˌjɑːnd-/ [verb phrase] asituationorforcethat is beyond your control is one that you are not able to control, especially if someone else is controlling it or because no one can control it :
▪ some of the kids there were beyond any teacher’s control.
circumstancesbeyond our control:a situation that we cannot control:
▪ due to circumstances beyond our control, we have had to cancel tonight’s performance of "carmen'.

children.name: get out of hand x
children.definition: get out of hand/get ˌaʊt əv ˈhænd/  if something, especially asituation, gets out of hand, it gets so serious or difficult that it can no longer be controlled:
examples: vượt ngoài tầm tay, nằm ngoài tầm kiểm soát
▪ the costs have continued to increase, and now seem to be getting out of hand.
chi phí tiếp tục gia tăng, dường như giờ đây đã vượt ra ngoài tầm tay
▪ police were called in when the situation began to get out of hand.
cảnh sát được kêu gọi khi tình hình bắt đầu vượt khỏi tầm tay.

children.name: runaway x
children.definition: runaway/ˈrʌnəweɪ/  increasing or spreading in an unexpected way that cannot be controlled: mất kiểm soát
examples: ▪ some economists are now predicting the danger of runaway inflation.
một số nhà kinh tế hiện nay đang dự đoán về sự lạm phát đang ngày càng trở nên mất kiểm soát
▪ they see technology as a runaway force that humans can no longer control.
họ cho rằng công nghệ là sự mất kiểm soát mà con người không thể quản lí được nữa

children.name: lose your grip x
children.definition: lose your grip(on something)/ˌluːz jɔːʳ ˈgrɪp (ɒn something )/  to no longer be able to control asituationthat you have had difficulty controlling for a long time:
examples: mất kiểm soát
▪ by 1965, us troops in the area were beginning to lose their grip.
lose your grip on something
▪ i was worried that clive seemed to be losing his grip on things.

children.name: rampant x
children.definition: rampant/ˈræmpənt/  growing, spreading or continuing very quickly, in a way that is impossible to stop - used especially in literature: lan tràn, tràn lan
examples: ▪ it wasn’t military action but rampant disease that finally caused the population to surrender.
▪ corruption soon became rampant.

children.name: run wild c2
children.definition: run wild/rʌn ˈwaɪld/  to grow or develop in a completely uncontrolled way:
examples: mọc lên như nấm, phát tán...
▪ organized crime has been running wild since the collapse of the old regime.
những tội ác có tổ chức đã đang mọc lên như nấm sau sự sụp đổ của chế độ cũ
▪ she allowed her imagination to run wild.
trí tưởng tượng của cô ta ngày càng tăng cao.

children.name: to be able to control sb because they like you
have sb eating out of your hand x
children.definition: have somebody eating out of your hand/hæv somebody ˌiːtɪŋ aʊt əv jɔːʳ ˈhænd/  to beableto control someone because you have made themlike youso much that they will do whatever you want:
examples: kiểm soát được ai ( vì họ thích bạn )
▪ i introduced mr wilkinson to my mother, and within minutes she had him eating out of her hand.
tôi giới thiệu ông wilkinson cho mẹ tôi và ngay vài phút sau bà ấy đã tin tưởng ông ta.
▪ he’s brilliant in job interviews -- he always manages to get the panel eating out of his hand.
anh ấy đã rất thông thạo trong các cuộc phỏng vấn, anh ta luôn luôn thành công nắm được quyền kiểm soát

children.name: wrap sb round your little finger x
children.definition: can wrap/twist somebody round your little finger/kən ˌræp, ˌtwɪst somebody raʊnd jɔːʳ ˌlɪtl ˈfɪŋgəʳ/  to beableto control someone so that they do what you want, especially because theyloveyou and want to make you happy:
examples: nắm gọn ai trong tay ( vì họ yêu bạn )
▪ get rebecca to ask dad for the money -- she can wrap him round her little finger.
bảo rebecca xin tiền bố đi - nó luôn lôi kéo được ông ấy
▪ mary knew she could twist henry round her little finger.
mary biết rằng cô ấy có thể lôi kéo được henry

children.name: control b2
children.definition: control/kənˈtrəʊl/  theabilityorpowerto make things happen or make people behavein the way that you want:
examples: khả năng / quyền quản lí, kiểm soát, điều khiển
( theo cách bạn muốn )
have control: có khả năng /quyền kiểm soát/quản lí/điều khiển
▪ heads of department can make some decisions, but the chairman has overall control within the company.
các trưởng phòng có thể đưa ra một số quyết định nhưng chủ tịch hội đồng có thể đưa ra quyền kiểm soát trong phạm vi toàn công ty
control over : quyền quản lí ai
▪ they seem to have no control over their children.
dường như họ không có quyền quản lí lũ trẻ
control of : quyền quản lí ai / cái gì
▪ who has control of the budget ?
ai có quyền quản lí ngân sách ?

children.name: assume c2
children.definition: assumeverbtake control
examples: to take or begin to have responsibility or control, sometimes without the right to do so, or to begin to have a characteristic
_the new president assumes office at midnight tonight.
_the terrorists assumed control of the plane and forced it to land in the desert.
_the issue has assumed considerable political proportions (= has become a big political problem) .

children.name: over c2
children.definition: overprepositioncontrol
examples: in control of or teaching someone or something
_a good teacher has an easy authority over a class.
_she's a sales manager but she has a regional sales director over (= with a higher rank than) her.
_the victory over the french atwaterloowaswellington's greatest triumph.
